name: io::io_port::allocator::IoPortAllocator::recycle

log::max_level.doc:
Returns the current maximum log level.

 The [`log!`], [`error!`], [`warn!`], [`info!`], [`debug!`], and [`trace!`] macros check
 this value and discard any message logged at a higher level. The maximum
 log level is set by the [`set_max_level`] function.

 [`log!`]: macro.log.html
 [`error!`]: macro.error.html
 [`warn!`]: macro.warn.html
 [`info!`]: macro.info.html
 [`debug!`]: macro.debug.html
 [`trace!`]: macro.trace.html
 [`set_max_level`]: fn.set_max_level.html

id_alloc::IdAlloc::free_consecutive.doc:
Releases the consecutive range of allocated `id`s.

 # Panics

 If the `range` is out of bounds, this method will panic.

doc:
Recycles an PIO range.

 # Safety

 The caller must have ownership of the PIO region through the `IoPortAllocator::acquire` interface.
